title: Martial wants long Utd stay
text:
Anthony Martial wants to stay with Manchester United for 'as long as possible' By Rory O'Callaghan Last Updated: 21/02/17 9:03pm Anthony Martial insists he is happy to remain with Manchester United Manchester United winger Anthony Martial insists he wants to remain at Old Trafford "for as long as possible". 
Martial has struggled to recreate the scintillating form he produced during his first season in English football and has now found himself fighting for first-team opportunities under Jose Mourinho. 
However, the 21-year-old - who became the most expensive teenager in history when he joined United from Monaco in 2015 - has started to show signs of improvement in recent weeks after starting three consecutive games. Martial has struggled to produce his best form this season 
The France international will be hoping to continue that run when United travel to St Etienne on Thursday for the second leg of their Europa League last-32 tie. 
Martial insists he has had no thoughts about leaving United, despite reports linking him with a move away from Old Trafford this summer. 
"I love Manchester, I love the club and I love the fans," said Martial. Wayne Rooney returned to Manchester United training on Tuesday 
"(The fans) give me a lot of joy and I really enjoy having them backing me. 
"I try to be as good as possible to make them happy, to satisfy them, so what I just want is to stay as long as possible at this club." Also See:
